content.text: AJAX is about updating parts of a web page, without reloading the whole page.
content.html: AJAX is about updating parts of a web page, without reloading the whole page.

content.text: AJAX is a technique for creating fast and dynamic web pages.
content.html: AJAX is a technique for creating fast and dynamic web pages.

content.text: AJAX allows web pages to be updated asynchronously by exchanging small amounts of data with the server behind the scenes. This means that it is possible to update parts of a web page, without reloading the whole page.
content.html: AJAX allows web pages to be updated asynchronously by exchanging small amounts of data with the server behind the scenes. This means that it is possible to update parts of a web page, without reloading the whole page.

content.text: Classic web pages, (which do not use AJAX) must reload the entire page if the content should change.
content.html: Classic web pages, (which do not use AJAX) must reload the entire page if the content should change.

content.text: Examples of applications using AJAX: Google Maps, Gmail, Youtube, and Facebook tabs.
content.html: Examples of applications using AJAX: Google Maps, Gmail, Youtube, and Facebook tabs.

content.text: AJAX applications are browser- and platform-independent!
AJAX was made popular in 2005 by Google, with Google Suggest.
content.html: AJAX was made popular in 2005 by Google, with Google Suggest.

content.text: Google Suggest is using AJAX to create a very dynamic web interface: When you start typing in Google's search box, a JavaScript sends the letters off to a server and the server returns a list of suggestions.
content.html: Google Suggest is using AJAX to create a very dynamic web interface: When you start typing in Google's search box, a JavaScript sends the letters off to a server and the server returns a list of suggestions.
